body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#24671](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24671) (build: remove unneeded configure $*val setting by fanquake)
* [#24322](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24322) ([kernel 1/n] Introduce initial `libbitcoinkernel` by dongcarl)
* [#23969](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23969) (build: remove use of TARGET_OS and BUILD_OS by fanquake)
* [#21570](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21570) (build, qt: Simplifies checks for `QT_REDUCE_RELOCATIONS` by hebasto)
* [#18427](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18427) (Bugfix? Restore linking to libmingwthrd by luke-jr)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Probably we should differentiate between necessary flags (eg, include paths) and provided defaults (eg, -O2 -g), and do "$DEFAULTS $USER $NECESSARY" so this just works without needing a special hack.
diff_hunk:
@@ -357,7 +357,9 @@ case $host in
 esac
 
 if test "$enable_debug" = "yes"; then
-  dnl Clear default -g -O2 flags
+  dnl If debugging is enabled, and the user hasn't overriden CXXFLAGS, clear
+  dnl them, to prevent autoconfs "-g -O2" being added. Otherwise we'd end up
+  dnl with "-O0 -g3 -g -O2".

body:
I think the philosophy (also according to [automake docs](https://www.gnu.org/software//automake/manual/html_node/Flag-Variables-Ordering.html)) is that the user has always the last word, so it should really be "$DEFAULTS $USER $NECESSARY". This gives the user also the last word on what is "necessary", e.g., the user may have a strange compiler/wrapper, where other flags are necessary. 

If the user wants to break the build by overriding flags, that's his choice. And even this can be helpful for debugging the build.
diff_hunk:
@@ -357,7 +357,9 @@ case $host in
 esac
 
 if test "$enable_debug" = "yes"; then
-  dnl Clear default -g -O2 flags
+  dnl If debugging is enabled, and the user hasn't overriden CXXFLAGS, clear
+  dnl them, to prevent autoconfs "-g -O2" being added. Otherwise we'd end up
+  dnl with "-O0 -g3 -g -O2".

body: Rebased on top of #24722, which should solve the macOS build failure.

> so it should really be "$DEFAULTS $USER $NECESSARY".

I assume you mean "$DEFAULTS $NECESSARY $USER" ?

I agree. The point of these change is to stop overriding user choice, so doing something that would prevent the user from having the final say would defeat the point.
diff_hunk:

-  dnl Clear default -g -O2 flags

+  dnl them, to prevent autoconfs "-g -O2" being added. Otherwise we'd end up
+  dnl with "-O0 -g3 -g -O2".

body: Rebased after #24722, and made some small fixups. Now that the CI is passing, opening this up for review.

diff_hunk:
@@ -2009,7 +2010,7 @@ echo "  build os        = $build_os"
 echo
 echo "  CC              = $CC"
 echo "  CFLAGS          = $PTHREAD_CFLAGS $CFLAGS"
-echo "  CPPFLAGS        = $DEBUG_CPPFLAGS $HARDENED_CPPFLAGS $CPPFLAGS"
+echo "  CPPFLAGS        = $DEBUG_CPPFLAGS $HARDENED_CPPFLAGS $CORE_CPPFLAGS $CORE_CPPFLAGS $CPPFLAGS"

@@ -2009,7 +2010,7 @@ echo "  build os        = $build_os"
 echo
 echo "  CC              = $CC"
 echo "  CFLAGS          = $PTHREAD_CFLAGS $CFLAGS"
-echo "  CPPFLAGS        = $DEBUG_CPPFLAGS $HARDENED_CPPFLAGS $CPPFLAGS"
+echo "  CPPFLAGS        = $DEBUG_CPPFLAGS $HARDENED_CPPFLAGS $CORE_CPPFLAGS $CORE_CPPFLAGS $CPPFLAGS"

body:
fe263822287ffbf650dd6dc6bae5f62b4c5d1ca7

This code works, but I'd suggest a safer future-proof one:
```suggestion
CORE_CPPFLAGS="$CORE_CPPFLAGS -DHAVE_BUILD_INFO"
```

> Should the configure script check whether a preprocessor/compiler/linker accepts user-provided flags?

No. Users are free to do what they want, and we shouldn't be trying to second guess them. That would also get in the way of letting them set their own flags.
Nice. I missed this a few months ago. Post merge concept-ACK.
